intro: Ischaemum koenigii, commonly known as wild cumin, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into small, three-lobed seeds. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Ischaemum koenigii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
